call: please do not call to test whether they are available. call for emergency assistance only. we will keep you informed of developments and will provide an update as soon as the services are restored.

turn on wifi calling.android: go to the calling app (green button) and choose the "settings" option from the local menu. turn on the option calling via wifi there.ios: go to settings > mobile network. turn on the option 'calling via wifi'.

is there an emergency, do you have vodafone as a provider and do you want to contact the emergency center? you can reach via the following alternatives.1. call via wi-fi.2. download the app for direct emergency contact.3. use a device with a different provider.

we generally need to show suspects completely blurred, not just their faces. the aim is mainly to call on the relevant suspect(s) to report to us, on the condition that the images otherwise go outside unblurred.
we actually only do blurry suspects if we can also bring suspects blurry shortly afterwards, and then the condition to first investigate other indications remains.

before we are allowed to go outside with images of suspects, the public prosecution service often sets the condition that all other investigative options must first be exhausted. that is why sharing images sometimes takes a long time.

the amsterdam detective department is conducting extensive research into the circumstances of the hostage taking on leidseplein. the investigation team led by the public prosecution service is keeping all options open about possible motive: .
the amsterdam triangle gave a press conference last night about the hostage taking in the apple store on leidseplein. read back the information shared there: .

the suspect has since been taken to hospital. for the time being, we are still conducting extensive research in the apple store on leidseplein. after the press conference later, we will focus on the investigation and will have more information at the earliest tomorrow during the course of the day.

a press conference will take place at :30 at the main office. media can identify themselves with a police press card. we will also share the information from the press conference live via instagram ()

we managed to stop the hostage-taker by hitting him as he ran out. there are intense images of that collision. we now know that the suspect had no explosives on his body and medical personnel are now taking care of him.

because of the - now ended hostage - in the apple store, a helicopter has been hovering over leidseplein for hours. unfortunately, this causes nuisance for residents. we hope for understanding and as soon as the helicopter is no longer needed, peace will return to the air.

we have now been able to bring even more people who were in the building to safety. investigations into the hostage-taker on the street are still ongoing. we are not able to give any information about his condition yet.

we can confirm that the hostage-taker is from the apple store. he is lying on the street and a robot is examining him for explosives. from a distance, policemen control him with firearms. the hostage is safe.

because the hostage situation in the apple store is still ongoing, we do not share information about the situation in and around the building for the safety of those involved. we would like to urge anyone with a view of the building not to publish or stream any visual material.

dozens of people who were able to leave the apple store earlier are taken care of by police officers. they go to a police location for a witness statement and of course for aftercare such as victim support.

since the start of the hostage taking in the apple store on leidseplein, several people have been able to leave the building. we do not want to share any information about the situation in and around the building at the moment.
there are several reports in the media about locations in the apple store where people might be. we would like to ask everyone to be cautious about sharing such information for security reasons.

regarding the safety of the people involved in the hostage situation at the apple store at leidseplein, we would like to ask all public to stay away from the site so the police can focus on dealing with the situation.

there is an ongoing hostage situation at the apple store at leidseplein at the moment. to ensure the safety of all people involved we are not able to share information about the situation and/or actions taken by the police.
we would like to ask people with a view of the apple store building to be cautious about publishing images or live streams, for the sake of the safety of those involved and our police efforts. /2.
there is currently still a hostage situation in the apple store on leidseplein. for the sake of the safety of those involved, we are reluctant to share information. /2
we ask local residents, entrepreneurs and employees at leidseplein not to come and have a look outside and to stay inside.
of course we also see the images on social media about the situation at leidseplein. we secure the images and include them in the investigation.
we are currently reluctant to provide information about the situation in the apple store at leidseplein in order not to disrupt our investigation and efforts there.

a -year-old man was injured in a stabbing incident on strackstraat in geuzenveld around p.m. he was taken to hospital in an accessible condition. suspects fled on foot. police call on witnesses to report: -8844.

a suspicious situation in the zilverberg parking lot in amsterdam north has led to a chase. two suspects have been arrested. a warning shot was fired during the arrest. the detective is investigating.
the fourth suspect was also arrested yesterday. this -year-old man from nijkerk is detained just like the other suspects and will be brought before the examining magistrate on friday.

that did not happen and the images were subsequently shared with the permission of the public prosecution service. we are now making another general appeal: report to the police, otherwise you run the risk that we will publish images [3/3].

the museumplein has been designated as a safety risk area. the triangle does not allow spontaneous demonstrations in the city. large groups are a threat to public health. there are indications that people want to abuse the right to demonstrate to commit violence.

at the moment, about people are in different groups with banners on the museumplein that are regarded by the triangle as one demonstration. this demonstration is therefore disbanded. groups are ordered to split up. distance

giving suspects the chance to report first can be such a way. several factors play a role in deciding whether this is a possibility, e.g. the seriousness of the offence. in this case, this is, among other things, the probably young age of the suspects [2/2].

showing (recognizable) images of suspects is a heavy means of investigation. when considering whether or not to use this means, the public prosecution service therefore always takes into account whether there are any other ways to obtain the identity of a suspect [1/2].
